editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Scholars of Merton College.

msItem.note: ff. i, ii blank. The lower three quarters of f. ii has been excised.

msItem.author: JOHN DUNS SCOTUS OFM
msItem.title: Commentary on III Sent. (Ordinatio or Opus Oxoniense)
msItem.incipit: (d. 1 q. 1) Circa incarnacionem de possibilitate. Vtrum possibile fuerit naturam humanam uniri Deo in unitate persone. Videtur quod non
msItem.explicit: Iugum enim meum suaue est et onus meum leue. Cui sit laus ...
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit lectura doctoris subtilis in uniuersitate Oxoniensi super tertium librum sencentiarum ...
msItem.colophon: Scriptus per me Iohannem Reynbold Almanicum de Monte Ornato anno Domini millesimo CCCC LIII
msItem.note: DSO (Balic) 9-10; Glorieux, Théol. 344r; Stegmüller, Sent. 421. On f. 122rv is an index in the elegant humanistica which indexed MSS 59-61.

msItem.author: JOHN DUNS SCOTUS OFM
msItem.title: Lectura on III Sent.
msItem.incipit: Circa distinctionem primam tercii libri queritur primo utrum sit possibile naturam humanam personaliter uniri uerbo diuino. Quod non, primo quia actus purus et infinitus non est alteri componibilis
msItem.explicit: (ends impf. in d. 37; edn. p. 354) uel dicendum quod Deus est Iudex

msItem.author: JOHN DUNS SCOTUS OFM
msItem.title: Commentary on III Sent. (Opus Parisiense)
msItem.incipit: (Beg. impf in d. 3 q. 1 schol. 1; edn. p. 432) et tamen non est ibi quies media
msItem.explicit: (d. 17; edn. p. 484) oratio exaudita in repetita
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit lectura incompleta doctoris subtilis in uniuersitate Parisiensi super tercium librum sentenciarum ...
msItem.colophon: Scriptus per me Iohannem Reynbold de Monte Ornato anno Domini millesimo CCCCLIII
msItem.note: DSO (Wadding) 11. 419-554; Glorieux, Théol. 344n; Stegmüller, Sent. 422. On f. 259 is an index of distinctiones and quaestiones in the same elegant humanistica as earlier; 259v blank.

supportDesc.extent:
261 leaves (ii + 259) 400 270
260 145
The edges lightly retrimmed and stained yellow. f. i is of thick, stiff parchment.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 52 long lines.

handDesc.handNote: As for MS 59. In art. 1 the scribe writes passages of gloss in the margin in a tiny hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: As for MS 59. Initials with full borders on ff. 1 (the initial excised) and 123 (Pl. 15). On f. 25v the marginal spray of the initial has been excised.

binding.p: s. xv, heavily restored by Maltby; flush, wide-bevelled oak boards now bare, rebacked with modern vellum, sewn on seven bands. Formerly two broad straps from shallow recesses at the front to catches at the back. Formerly chained from the front board, at the foredge near the foot, and from the back board, at the foredge near the head. ff. i and 259, once pastedowns, show traces of pink on the turn-ins.

history.provenance: As for MS 59. On f. iiv, in the same humanistica as the indexes, ‘Orate pro anima magistri Ricardi Scardeburgh sacre theologie professoris qui istos libros fieri fecit quos postea magister Thomas Bloxham in medicinis doctor ab eodem emit et huic collegio dedit; orate igitur pro utroque’, followed by a table of contents in the same hand(Pl. 31). On f. ivare ‘N. 5. 7. Art:’, s. xvii, canc. and replaced with ‘G. 3. 2 (No. LXII)’, in red; the College bookplate. ‘5’ altered to ‘4’, or vice versa, is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.
